result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Barton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate, specifically sex offender treatment and cognitive programming.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with victim or the child without prior approval of agent.  Must be compliant with Sex Offender Registry and comply with rules and regulations thereof.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Defendant William R Barton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Defendant William R Barton in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends 10 yrs IC, ES left up to the Court.

BTC: 15CF347-Total sentence is 8 yrs WPS bifurcated as 4 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES/CFTS
         15CF1608 - Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES, consec to Ct 1

costs

any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically sex offender treatment, cognitive programming

ALONG WITH $2,500.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH MOTHER, PHYLLIS BARTON, DOB  01-28-1957. Ct 1: 948.02(2)-2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child. No contact with the victim, D.A.Z. (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Exceptions are going to court and meeting with attorney.  Defendant may attend mother's medical appointments with approval from ZCI. Must obey all rules of mother's home.Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
07/20/15 - BOND AMENDED TO allow Defendant to attend all appointments with Dr. Westendorf. To notify ZCI prior to appointment with date/time.

AMENDED 07-28-2015 - DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND ATTEND CHURCH ON SUNDAY IN THE PRESENCE OF ONE OR BOTH OF HIS PARENTS. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE UP TO 5 HOURS PER WEEK TO SEARCH FOR EMPLOYMENT. ALL DATES, TIMES AND LOCATIONS MUST BE VERIFIED WITH ZCI. DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND EMPLOYMENT IF IT IS ATTAINED.

Defendant William R Barton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Gutowski asks that bond be modified to remove GPS or in the alternative release for doctor appts for deft and also to allow deft to do a work search and to attend church on Sunday morning. The State does not object to allow deft to go to doctor appts and church with parents but not the rest.

BTC: modify bond to allow deft to attend medical appointments and to attend church on Sunday in the presence of one or both of his parents. Defendant may have up to 5 hours per week for job search. All dates, times and locations must be approved by ZCI. Deft may attend employment if it is attained

Defendant William R Barton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Defendant William R Barton in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Defense asks that bond be modified to $2,500.00 cash with co-signature bond with mother, Phyllis Barton, 01-28-1957. Deft is willing to go on ELM. The State asks the Court to inquire if the co-signer has liquid assets to cover any bond. The State objects to modification of bond-argument put on the record. 

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond may be modified to $5000.00 - $2,500.00 and $2,500.00 co-signature with mother, Phyllis Barton, 01/28/1957. GPS/house arrest. May attend mother's medical appointments with approval of ZCI. May attend court and attorney visits. Must obey rules of mother's home. All other conditions previously ordered remain.
